text: The 1984–85 Soviet Cup was an association football cup competition of the Soviet Union. The winner of the competition, Dinamo Kiev qualified for the continental tournament. ==Competition schedule== ===First preliminary round=== All games took place on July 31, 1984. {| style="width:100%;" cellspacing="1" |- !width=20%| !width=12%| !width=20%| ! |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Samarkand |align=center|4:1 | Guria Lanchkhuti | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dnepr Mogilev |align=center|2:0 | Daugava Riga | |- style=font- size:90% |align=right| Geolog Tyumen |align=center|2:0 | Zvezda Jizak | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Kotaik Abovyan |align=center|3:2 | Shinnik Yaroslavl | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Kuban Krasnodar |align=center|1:1 | Pamir Dushanbe |, |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Metallurg Magnitogorsk |align=center|3:0 | Rotor Volgograd | |- style=font- size:90% |align=right| Niva Vinnitsa |align=center|2:1 | Metallurg Zaporozhie | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Rostselmash Rostov-na-Donu |align=center|3:2 | Zaria Voroshilovgrad | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| SKA Khabarovsk |align=center|3:0 | Irtysh Omsk | |- style=font- size:90% |align=right| Sudostroitel Nikolaev |align=center|3:2 | SKA Karpaty Lvov | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Svetotekhnika Saransk |align=center|1:5 | Spartak Ordzhonikidze | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Tselinnik Tselinograd |align=center|2:1 | Tavria Simferopol | |} ===Second preliminary round=== All games took place on August 10 (or 20), 1984. {| style="width:100%;" cellspacing="1" |- !width=20%| !width=12%| !width=20%| ! |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Batumi |align=center|1:0 | Dnepr Mogilev | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Samarkand |align=center|3:1 | Fakel Voronezh | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Iskra Smolensk |align=center|3:0 | Metallurg Magnitogorsk | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Geolog Tyumen |align=center|0:0 | Tselinnik Tselinograd |, |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Kotaik Abovyan |align=center|3:0 | Kolos Nikopol | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Kuzbass Kemerovo |align=center|1:0 | Sudostroitel Nikolaev | |- style=font- size:90% |align=right| Nistru Kishinev |align=center|2:1 | Kuban Krasnodar | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Niva Vinnitsa |align=center|3:0 | Rostselmash Rostov-na-Donu | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| SKA Khabarovsk |align=center|6:1 | Torpedo Kutaisi | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Spartak Ordzhonikidze |align=center|2:0 | Lokomotiv Moskva | |} ===Round of 32=== The base game day was September 17, 1984 {| style="width:100%;" cellspacing="1" |- !width=20%| !width=12%| !width=20%| ! |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Chernomorets Odessa |align=center|3:2 | Neftchi Baku | (September 16, 1984) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Batumi |align=center|1:0 | Pahtakor Tashkent | (September 16, 1984) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Samarkand |align=center|0:0 | Zhalgiris Vilnius |, (September 16, 1984) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Kairat Alma-Aty |align=center|3:1 | Spartak Ordzhonikidze | (September 16, 1984) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Zenit Leningrad |align=center|4:0 | SKA Khabarovsk | (September 16, 1984) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Ararat Yerevan |align=center|3:1 | Kuzbass Kemerovo | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| CSKA Moscow |align=center|2:0 | Geolog Tyumen | |- style=font- size:90% |align=right| Iskra Smolensk |align=center|2:2 | Dinamo Tbilisi |, |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Kotaik Abovyan |align=center|1:3 | Shakhter Donetsk | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Metallist Kharkov |align=center|0:1 | Torpedo Moscow | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Nistru Kishinev |align=center|2:4 | Dinamo Kiev | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Niva Vinnitsa |align=center|2:1 | SKA Rostov-na-Donu | |} ===Round of 16=== The base game day was October 28, 1984 {| style="width:100%;" cellspacing="1" |- !width=20%| !width=12%| !width=20%| ! |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| CSKA Moscow |align=center|3:0 | Dinamo Batumi | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Kiev |align=center|1:1 | Dinamo Moscow |, |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Minsk |align=center|2:1 | Chernomorets Odessa | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Shakhter Donetsk |align=center|2:1 | Ararat Yerevan | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Torpedo Moscow |align=center|0:1 | Dnepr Dnepropetrovsk | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Spartak Moscow |align=center|0:3 | Zenit Leningrad |(October 29, 1984) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Kairat Alma-Ata |align=center|1:0 | Niva Vinnitsa |(November 12, 1984) |- style=font- size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Samarkand |align=center|0:1 | Iskra Smolensk |(November 14, 1984) |} ===Quarter-finals=== The base game day was May 10, 1985 {| style="width:100%;" cellspacing="1" |- !width=20%| !width=12%| !width=20%| ! |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Kiev |align=center|2:1 | Kairat Alma-Ata | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Iskra Smolensk |align=center|1:0 | Dinamo Minsk | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Shakhter Donetsk |align=center|2:1 | Dnepr Dnepropetrovsk | |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Zenit Leningrad |align=center|2:0 | CSKA Moscow | |} ===Semi-finals=== {| style="width:100%;" cellspacing="1" |- !width=20%| !width=12%| !width=20%| ! |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Shakhter Donetsk |align=center|0:0 | Zenit Leningrad |, (May 23, 1985) |- style=font-size:90% |align=right| Dinamo Kiev |align=center|3:0 | Iskra Smolensk | (May 24, 1985) |} ===Final=== ==External links== * Complete calendar. helmsoccer.narod.ru * 1984–85 Soviet Cup.
